meanings.definition: A person who resists or opposes change, especially in politics or society.
meanings.sent1: The standpatter refused to consider any new ideas for improving the community.
meanings.sent2: The standpatter always votes for the same political party, no matter what.
meanings.sent3: The standpatter insisted on using a typewriter instead of a computer for work.
meanings.sent4: She was a standpatter when it came to her favorite TV show, never missing an episode.
meanings.sent5: The standpatter's stubbornness was like a rock in the river of progress.

meanings.definition: To be resistant to change or innovation.
meanings.sent1: He tends to standpatter when it comes to trying new foods.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to standpatter and stick with their old manufacturing methods.
meanings.sent3: She always standpatters when it's time to update her wardrobe.
meanings.sent4: The old tree in the yard standpattered against the strong winds.
meanings.sent5: His mind standpattered like a rusty gate, unwilling to open to new ideas.
